TER.TERCommon
Class ConversionTools

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERCommon.ConversionTools

public class ConversionTools
extends java.lang.Object

This class contain some conversion tools, they convert some file measures in the corresponding segByteLimit value

Version:
2.0
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

getSegByteLimitFromBPS

public static int[][] getSegByteLimitFromBPS(float[] bps,
                                             int[][] blocksPerSegment,
                                             int[] WTLevels,
                                             int ySize,
                                             int xSize,
                                             int[] pixelBitDepth)
Given the bits per pixel computes the number of bytes that must be used to encode each segment

Parameters:
bps - float array that contains the bits per pixel of each segment
blocksPerSegment - definition in SegmentCode2D.blocksPerSegment
WTLevels - definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTLevels
ySize - image height
xSize - image width
Returns:
an integer containing the number of bytes that must be used to encode each segment

getSegByteLimitFromCompressionFactor

public static int[][] getSegByteLimitFromCompressionFactor(float[] compressionFactor,
                                                           int[] pixelBitDepth,
                                                           int[][] blocksPerSegment,
                                                           int[] WTLevels,
                                                           int ySize,
                                                           int xSize)
Given the compression ratio computes the number of bytes that must be used to encode each segment

Parameters:
compressionFactor - float array that contains the compression factor for each segment
pixelBitDepth - pixel bit depth of the input image
blocksPerSegment - definition in SegmentCode2D.blocksPerSegment
WTLevels - definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTLevels * @param blocksPerSegment
ySize - image height
xSize - image width
Returns:
an integer containing the number of bytes that must be used to encode each segment
